sentences.sContent: He faces six charges of bringing the game into disrepute .
sentences.sCn: 他面临六项破坏这项运动声誉的指控。

sentences.sContent: This theory fell into disrepute in the fifties.
sentences.sCn: 这一理论在50年代时声誉尽失。

remMethod.val: dis(不) + repute(名声) → 不好的名声 → 坏名声

words.tran: 声名狼藉的；肮脏的；破烂不堪的

trans.tranOther: a situation in which people no longer admire or trust someone or something
